ticket

Class ElectronicTicket.TicketBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • ticket.ElectronicTicket.TicketBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IBuilder<ElectronicTicket>
    Enclosing class:
    ElectronicTicket

    public static class ElectronicTicket.TicketBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements IBuilder<ElectronicTicket>
    The TicketBuilder is used to construct instances of ElectronicTicket. This class implements the IBuilder interface and the Builder pattern. All setter methods inside this class return the same instance of the builder to allow cascaded invocations of setter methods. Finally the build() method builds the instance and can be appended to the sequence of set calls.

    Example Usage: 

         ElectronicTicket.TicketBuilder builder = new ElectronicTicket.TicketBuilder();
     ElectronicTicket ticket = builder.setVoyager(anyVoyager)
                                      .setTravelTime(new Date())
                                      .setTravelCategory(TravelClass.FIRST)
                                      .setSeat(leftSeat)
                                      .setSourceLocation(Source.Berlin)
                                      .setDestinationLocation(Destination.Munich)
                                      .build();

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ElectronicTicket build()
      Constructs the final instance of the ticket, registers this ticket into the ticket repository, sends the ticket to the voyager's phone, reserves the associated seat and returns the instance.

      Resets the internal static ticket id counter back to 0.

    • Field Detail

      • ticketId

        private static int ticketId
        ticketId is a static number inside the ticket builder which is incremented automatically when a ticked is constructed. It takes care about giving an unique id to each of the tickets.
        See Also:
        ElectronicTicket.ticketId
